title: Sidewall - Fragment, 1840–1900
provenance: Wallpaper fragment from No. 51 Market Street, New York, the Rutgers family farm, 1825.
description: a) Top layer; on discolored white background, pale gray flat leaf patterns with scalloped edges, white background exposed to represent veining. Reserved white areas within gray leaves form smaller leaf patterns with veining in thin blue lines, and blue pin-work; b) Border over top layer: brown, green, and orange flocked rococo-revival leafy-scroll pattern; c) gray on white leaf-like pattern; d) bottom layer: gray on white overall pattern possible meant to represent wood graining (?); e) border: maroon background with bright pink and blue flowers, green leaves.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sidewall - Fragment, 1840–1900.
1840–1900. Machine-printed, flocked. Gift of Diana de Rouche. 1967-64-1-a/e.
